result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: i.e.CdS and TiO 2 .With increasing the content of TiO 2 , the activity increases first and then reverts back.The highest value comes from the composite CdSTiO 2 1:1.The possible reason is that excessive TiO 2 NPs will wrap around CdS nanocrystals and electrons in CdS fail to transfer outwards to participate in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.In particular, the CH 4 yield rate of CdSTiO 2 1:1 reaches quite high, up to 27.85 mol g -1 h -1 , which is 145.6 and 3.8 times higher than that of pristine CdS and

the intimate linkage between CdS and TiO 2 and the favorable step-scheme heterojunction, enhanced photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity was accomplished.The CH 4 yield rate of CdSTiO 2 reaches 27.85 mol g -1 h -1 , which is 145.6 and 3.8 times higher than those of pristine CdS and TiO 2 , respectively.This work presents a novel insight into constructing step-scheme photocatalytic system with desirable performance.

Converting solar energy into chemical energy by artificial photosynthesis is promising in addressing the issues of the greenhouse effect and fossil fuel crisis.Herein, a novel photocatalyst, i.e.CdSTiO 2 hollow microspheres (HS), were dedicatedly designed to boost overall photocatalytic efficiency.TiO 2 nanoparticles were in-situ decorated on the inside and outside the shell of CdS HS, ensuring close contact between TiO 2 and CdS.The CdSTiO 2 HS with abundant mesopores inside of the shell boost the light

accords with the analysis of photoelectrochemistry and photoluminescence (PL) spectra.To detect the stability of CdSTiO 2 HS, three successive photocatalytic CO 2 reduction tests for nine hours in total were conducted.In Fig. 2(b), CdSTiO 2 HS experience a certain loss of products except for CH 3 OH.The CH 3 OH yield rate tends to be saturated after one hour, suggesting that CH 3 OH may be an intermediate product for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.After 9 h, the photocatalytic activity loss for CH 4 of

in the excited state.Therefore, the prolonged fluorescence lifetime endows photogenerated charge carriers with sufficient time to migrate to the surface of photocatalyst and participate in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction. Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity for CdS HS, TiO 2 , and CdSTiO 2 HS composite was appraised under full-spectrum irradiation using a 350 W xenon lamp.As shown in Fig. 2(a), three kinds of gaseous products: CO, CH 4 , and CH 3 OH are detected for CdS HS with a production

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

and theoretical molar ratio.For the sake of convenience, the theoretical molar ratio is chosen when referring to the samples. The light absorption of CdS HS, TiO 2 and CdSTiO 2 HS with various molar ratios was evaluated by UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectroscopy (DRS) in Fig. S3(a) in the Supplementary Material.The DRS spectra of neat CdS HS and TiO 2 show absorption edge at 575 nm and 390 nm, respectively.By contrast, DRS spectra of CdSTiO 2 composites merge the optical properties of each component

photocatalytic CO 2 reduction rather than other impurities. To reveal the intermediate species in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction process, in-situ DRIFTS spectra were obtained.As shown in Fig. 3(a), no available signal can be detected without CO 2 flow and light irradiation.When the CO 2 gas with water vapor flows through the sample chamber for 10 min, some strong peaks originating from carbonate species adsorbed on the surface of CdSTiO 2 can be observed.The peaks located at 1535 and 1290 cm -1 can be

activity loss for CH 4 of CdSTiO 2 HS is 19.As a whole, CdSTiO 2 HS exhibit satisfied stability in photocatalytic CO 2 tests.Further, the isotopic tracer test was investigated by photocatalytic reduction of 12 C-and 13 C-labeled CO 2 .In Fig. 2(c) and (d), the distinctive signals of mz 17 and 29 validate that the dominant resultant CH 4 and CO in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction derive from 13 CO 2 carbon sources.The result clarifies that carbonaceous products originate from photocatalytic CO 2 reduction

evidence.pdf_reference: Converting solar energy into chemical energy by artificial photosynthesis is promising in addressing the issues of the greenhouse effect and fossil fuel crisis.Herein, a novel photocatalyst, i.e.CdSTiO 2 hollow microspheres (HS), were dedicatedly designed to boost overall photocatalytic efficiency.TiO 2 nanoparticles were in-situ decorated on the inside and outside the shell of CdS HS, ensuring close contact between TiO 2 and CdS.The CdSTiO 2 HS with abundant mesopores inside of the shell boost the light

in the excited state.Therefore, the prolonged fluorescence lifetime endows photogenerated charge carriers with sufficient time to migrate to the surface of photocatalyst and participate in the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction. Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity for CdS HS, TiO 2 , and CdSTiO 2 HS composite was appraised under full-spectrum irradiation using a 350 W xenon lamp.As shown in Fig. 2(a), three kinds of gaseous products: CO, CH 4 , and CH 3 OH are detected for CdS HS with a production

of the shell boost the light absorption via multiscattering effect as well as accessible to reactions in all directions.The heterojunction was scrutinized and the charge transfer across it was revealed by in-situ irradiated X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (ISI-XPS).Ultimately, the charge transfer in this composite was determined to follow stepscheme mechanism, which not only facilitates the separation of charge carriers but also preserves strong redox ability.Benefited from the intimate linkage between

the intimate linkage between CdS and TiO 2 and the favorable step-scheme heterojunction, enhanced photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity was accomplished.The CH 4 yield rate of CdSTiO 2 reaches 27.85 mol g -1 h -1 , which is 145.6 and 3.8 times higher than those of pristine CdS and TiO 2 , respectively.This work presents a novel insight into constructing step-scheme photocatalytic system with desirable performance.
